channel.title: I'm Making a new development team! *LOOK HERE TO JOIN* * MOST LANGUAGES*
channel.description:
Hi guys, as everyone who codes even just a little bit knows that its very time comsuming. I've had lots of ideas that i haven't brought to life because. So now I'm going to start a development team. We will be creating anything like simple & complex programs, facebook apps, ipod/iphone apps, and Private Servers. To join, you will need to sign up on * Once your signed in click the "Join the Dev Team" in the Nav Bar. Fill the request out with the layout below and rate your skills as Beginner,Apprentice,Intermediate,Advanced, or Expert. MS-Dos cmd - (SKILL RATING HERE) PHP - (SKILLRATING HERE) HTML - (SKILL RATING HERE) VB.NET - (SKILL RATING HERE) C# - (SKILL RATING HERE) C++ - (SKILL RATING HERE) Java - (SKILL RATING HERE)
Thank you all for your time and I hope you join. Happy Coding to all, grundyboy34

item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

You cannot redirect people from this website to your website so that they may apply for your development team, as that is considered advertising. All recruitment must be done in this section, as this is what the section was designed for.

item.title: I'm Making a new development team! *LOOK HERE TO JOIN* * MOST LANGUAGES*
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“grundyboy34, post:5, topic:366177”]int i, n = 20;
for (i=0; i<n; n–)
{
cout << “x” << endl;
}

int i, n = 20;
for (i=0; i+n; i–)
{
cout << “x” << endl;
}

int i, n = 20;
for (i=0;-i<n; i–)
{
cout << “x” << endl;
}[/quote]

2 and 3 is wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Making a new development team! *LOOK HERE TO JOIN* * MOST LANGUAGES*
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

grundyboy34:

like what?

take the following code:

int i, n = 20;
for (i=0; i<n; i--)
{
cout << "x" << endl;
}

by changing only ONE character in the above code, meaning you cannot change 20 to 31, because you will have changed two characters, you can change 20 to 21, because you only changed the 0, do the following:

find 3 ways to make the above code print x 20 times (by changing only one character).

dcjr84 from codecall wrote that question.

Do it in any language. Doesn’t matter. Even scripting supports this.

Read full topic
